title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse and change them later. They act as named containers for data.
key_points: They have a name and a value
Values can change during program execution
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?
sample_answer: A variable is a named storage location that holds a value which can change during program execution.

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat a block of code multiple times until a condition is met. Common loops are for and while.
key_points: They stop when a condition is false
Examples: for loop and while loop
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.
sample_answer: A for loop iterates a set number of times or over a sequence; a while loop repeats until a condition becomes false.
